unnormalised: **Automotive Sector Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches**
normalised: Automotive Sector Gears Up for a Flurry of Vehicle Launches

unnormalised: The Indian automotive market is set to witness a surge in new vehicle launches in the coming months, catering to diverse consumer needs. Experts at IIT Madras predict a significant increase in Electric Vehicle (EV) adoption, fueled by upcoming models with extended range and improved charging infrastructure.
normalised: The Indian automotive market is set to witness a surge in new vehicle launches in the coming months, catering to diverse consumer needs. Experts at I I T Madras predict a significant increase in Electric Vehicle (E V) adoption, fueled by upcoming models with extended range and improved charging infrastructure.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki India is rumoured to be launching a compact SUV, codenamed "YFG," aimed at capturing the burgeoning sub-4-meter SUV segment. Dr. Meena Iyer, an automotive analyst, notes that competitive pricing will be key, with an expected price point starting around Rs. 7 lakhs.
normalised: Maruti Suzuki India is rumored to be launching a compact S U V, codenamed "Y F G," aimed at capturing the burgeoning sub-four-meter S U V segment. Doctor Meena Iyer, an automotive analyst, notes that competitive pricing will be key, with an expected price point starting around rupee seven lakhs.

unnormalised: Tata Motors is also expected to unveil an updated version of their popular Nexon EV, boasting a larger battery pack and a claimed range of over 450 km. Meanwhile, Mahindra is reportedly working on an all-electric version of their iconic Scorpio, aiming for a launch in early 2025.
normalised: Tata Motors is also expected to unveil an updated version of their popular Nexon E V, boasting a larger battery pack and a claimed range of over four hundred and fifty kilometer. Meanwhile, Mahindra is reportedly working on an all-electric version of their iconic Scorpio, aiming for a launch in early two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: These launches are expected to boost the Indian economy and create new job opportunities in manufacturing and related sectors. The expansion of charging infrastructure across national highways, covering significant land area (in sq ft), will be crucial for the success of EVs. Analysts foresee a robust growth trajectory for the Indian automotive industry, driven by innovation and consumer demand during the festive season, traditionally considered auspicious in Indian culture.
normalised: These launches are expected to boost the Indian economy and create new job opportunities in manufacturing and related sectors. The expansion of charging infrastructure across national highways, covering significant land area (in square feet), will be crucial for the success of E V s. Analysts foresee a robust growth trajectory for the Indian automotive industry, driven by innovation and consumer demand during the festive season, traditionally considered auspicious in Indian culture.
